title: [BUG] : `spack compiler` command doesn't work correctly for multiple architecture
body:
##### TLDR

Updates to one particular architecture in `compilers.yaml` seem to discard the information on all the other architectures.
##### Description

The bug can be reproduced in the following way. In the first shell, assuming `SYS_TYPE=<first>`

``` bash
$ spack compilers
==> Available compilers
-- gcc ----------------------------------------------------------
gcc@4.8

$ spack config get compilers
compilers:
  <first>:
    gcc@4.8:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
```

On a second shell, within the same spack installation, assuming `SYS_TYPE=<second>`:

``` bash
$ spack compilers
==> Available compilers
-- gcc ----------------------------------------------------------
gcc@4.8

$ spack config get compilers
compilers:
  <first>:
    gcc@4.8:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
  <second>:
    gcc@4.8:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc-4.8
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++-4.8
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran-4.8
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran-4.8
```

Coming back to the first shell : 

``` bash
$ spack install gcc@5.3.0
...
$ spack load gcc@5.3.0
$ spack compiler add
==> Added 1 new compiler to /home/mculpo/.spack/compilers.yaml
    gcc@5.3.0
$ spack config get compilers
compilers:
  <first>:
    gcc@4.8:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
    gcc@5.3.0:
      cc: /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/opt/spack/<first>/gcc-4.8/gcc-5.3.0-n2e5zswyv6xf5evzzj4t3aulvlkwjyno/bin/gcc
      cxx: /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/opt/spack/<first>/gcc-4.8/gcc-5.3.0-n2e5zswyv6xf5evzzj4t3aulvlkwjyno/bin/g++
      f77: /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/opt/spack/<first>/gcc-4.8/gcc-5.3.0-n2e5zswyv6xf5evzzj4t3aulvlkwjyno/bin/gfortran
      fc: /home/mculpo/PycharmProjects/spack/opt/spack/<first>/gcc-4.8/gcc-5.3.0-n2e5zswyv6xf5evzzj4t3aulvlkwjyno/bin/gfortran

```

At this point the architecture `<second>` has been removed from the configuration file.
